entry.title: Forestry Program for Oregon Subcommittee meets Aug. 15
entry.summary:
SALEM, Ore. — The Forestry Program for Oregon Subcommittee will meet virtually on Thursday, Aug. 15 from 8 to 9 a.m. To join virtually, please use the Zoom video conference information found on the agenda. The subcommittee’s agenda includes:
Review of current draft for Vision of Oregon’s Forests
Accommodations for people with disabilities, and special materials, services, or assistance can be arranged by calling ODF’s Public Affairs Office at least 72 hours in advance of the meeting at 503-945-7200 or by email at forestryinformation@odf.oregon.gov. Subcommittee purpose: Collaborative work forum for board and agency leadership to advance efforts to jointly develop a modern Forestry Program for Oregon (FPFO). Read more information about the subcommittee.

entry.title: There's still time to comment on hazard map draft, administrative rules
entry.summary: SALEM, Ore. — The public still has time to provide comments about both the draft statewide wildfire hazard map and proposed administrative rules associated with the map. These public comment opportunities are among the last steps before the release of the final map in October 2024. The proposed administrative rules will be used by OSU to address how irrigated agricultural lands are considered when assessing hazard for the map and will establish the process for appealing a hazard zone or wildland-urban interface designation. Three public hearings were conducted virtually last week, but additional written comments can be sent to maprules@odf.oregon.gov until 5 p.m. on Aug. 15. Input received will be shared with the Board of Forestry prior to their decision on whether to adopt the rules. Ple…

entry.title: Sheriff's Office Downgrades Previous Level 2 to a Level 1 Evacuation Notice for Areas Near the Lemolo Fire
entry.summary: 𝐒𝐇𝐄𝐑𝐈𝐅𝐅'𝐒 𝐎𝐅𝐅𝐈𝐂𝐄 𝐃𝐎𝐖𝐍𝐆𝐑𝐀𝐃𝐄𝐒 𝐋𝐄𝐕𝐄𝐋 𝟐 𝐓𝐎 𝐋𝐄𝐕𝐄𝐋 𝟏 𝐄𝐕𝐀𝐂𝐔𝐀𝐓𝐈𝐎𝐍 𝐍𝐎𝐓𝐈𝐂𝐄 𝐅𝐎𝐑 𝐀𝐑𝐄𝐀𝐒 𝐍𝐄𝐀𝐑 𝐓𝐇𝐄 𝐋𝐄𝐌𝐎𝐋𝐎 𝐅𝐈𝐑𝐄 IDLEYLD PARK, Ore - The Sheriff's Office has downgraded a previous evacuation Level 2 - SET near Lemolo Lake to a Level 1 - BE READY evacuation notice due to a reduced safety risk to the public. The area being downgraded to a LEVEL 1 - BE READY includes the following: • Lemolo KOA Campground • Poole Creek Campground/Boat Ramp • East Lemolo Campground • USFS 2614 Road south of Inlet Campground. This includes the Kelsay Valley, Pumice Flat and Elbow Butte Areas The downgrade is effective on August 6, 2024, at 7:00 pm. A LEVEL 1 - BE READY EVACUATION NOTICE means you should be aware of the danger that exists in the area, monitor emergency services websites and local media outlets for information. This is the time for preparation and precautionary movement of persons with special needs, mobile property and (under certain circumstances) pets and livestock. If conditions worsen, emergency services personnel may contact you via an emergency notification system. Although the evacuation level has been reduced in this area, it is important to know that the United States Forest Service has a significant forest closure in place, which may include the above campgrounds. This forest closure is independent of the Sheriff's Office evacuation notice process. For current information on the status of the campgrounds and associated forest closure, please contact the United States Forest Service. A current interactive evacuation map can be found on our website at https://www.dcso.com/evacuations.

entry.title: Douglas County Fair sets up for Wednesday kickoff
entry.summary: Douglas County Fair will open Wednesday, which means almost everyone on fairground property Monday was involved in the mad scramble of final preparations.

entry.title: A teacher's busy summer brings new opportunities for students
entry.summary: Camas Valley agriculture teacher Heather Brown took her summer break to attend school before heading into her seventh year of ag teaching.

entry.title: MYRTLE CREEK POLICE SEEKING MISSING MCMINNVILLE WOMAN
entry.summary: August 6, 2024 5:15 a.m. Officials with the Myrtle Creek Police are seeking a missing McMinnville woman. Detective Kevin Taggart said Monday just before 6:00 p.m. MCPD received a report that 69-year- old Kathleen Wilson had been on her way to visit a friend in Chiloquin, when she ended up staying in the Millsite RV...

entry.title: AIR QUALITY ALERT UNTIL 2:00 P.M. WEDNESDAY
entry.summary: August 6, 2024 3:50 a.m. The Oregon Department of Environmental Quality has issued an Air Pollution Advisory until 2:00 p.m. Wednesday. The Advisory area is for eastern Douglas and northern Klamath counties due to wildfires burning in the region. The DEQ also expects intermittent smoke in Jackson, Josephine, and Lake counties through at least Wednesday...

entry.title: DFPA REDUCES PUBLIC USE RESTRICTIONS TO HIGH
entry.summary: August 6, 2024 3:40 a.m. The Douglas Forest Protective Association has reduced the Public Use Restriction Level to HIGH, effective Tuesday. Public Information Officer Rachel Pope said this for all private, county, state and Bureau of Indian Affairs lands within the Douglas District, which imposes certain fire restrictions on the public to help prevent wildfires....

entry.title: COUNTY COMMISSIONERS TO RECOGNIZE NATIONAL COAST GUARD DAY
entry.summary: August 6, 2024 3:30 a.m. Douglas County Commissioners Chris Boice, Tim Freeman and Tom Kress will be issuing a proclamation recognizing National Coast Guard Day at a presentation on Wednesday at 12:00 pm. This is during the week of the USCGs 234th birthday. A county release said the presentation will take place at the Umpqua...

entry.title: FINAL HALF SHELL CONCERT OF 2024 TUESDAY NIGHT
entry.summary: August 6, 2024 3:20 a.m. In the KQEN Cultural Spotlight: Music on the Half Shell will have its final concert for 2024, Tuesday night at 7:00 p.m. at the Nichol’s Band Shell in Roseburg’s Stewart Park. Paul McDonald has been compared to legends like Rod Stewart and Bob Dylan. The rock artist has a raspy...

entry.title: UCC HOLDING 60TH ANNIVERSARY CELEBRATION EVENT
entry.summary: August 6, 2024 3:05 a.m. Umpqua Community College will celebrate the 60th anniversary of the founding of the college on Saturday, September 21st from 12:00 p.m. to 7:30 p.m. Activities will include live entertainment, food trucks, alumni basketball and volleyball games, a “Hawk” History Walk across the UCC campus and more. A featured performance from...

entry.title: NATIONAL FARMERS MARKET WEEK THROUGH SATURDAY
entry.summary: August, 2024 2:50 a.m. National Farmers Market Week continues through August 10th. Umpqua Valley Farmers Market in Roseburg will celebrate on Saturday. Activities include a photo booth, an opportunity to write notes about why you love your farmers to show your appreciation to them, a local artist market painting raffle, the opportunity to win prizes...
